ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Okay...new term (to me) de-levelling?
ygData.msgSnippet: The only way I can explain it.... I don t know how much a rogue can normally backstab...so sorry but if a: level 10 can backstab for 40 and a level 20 can
ygData.messageBody:
The only way I can explain it....

I don't know how much a rogue can normally backstab...so sorry

but if a:

level 10 can backstab for 40
and a level 20 can backstab for 300

a person on a pvp server levels to 20...then purposly loses exp until level
10 again...

a level 10 (deleveled from 20) can backstab for 300



> -----Original Message-----
> From: stonemn@... [SMTP:stonemn@...]
> Sent: Monday, April 23, 2001 1:22 PM
> To: everquest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EverQuest] Okay...new term (to me) de-levelling?
>
> I was wandering around Oasis w/ my 13 bard and my groupmate (higher than
> me) hot jumped by someone approximately his level (around 14-15), and he
> said his attacker was "de-leveled" because of the amount of damage he did.
> Do you not lose your skill levels when you lose a level?
>
